comments:
AddMemoryRenderingActionDelegate is an IEditorActionDelegate.  When it gets initialized, it will try to figure out the current debug context.  I got the following exception when getting context.  DebugWindowContextService gets the LaunchView when calling this line:

IDebugContextProvider provider = (IDebugContextProvider) fProvidersByPartId.get(partId);

LaunchView should not have been stored in fProvidersByPartId.  fProvidersByPartId should return LaunchView's fProvider instead?

java.lang.ClassCastException: org/eclipse/debug/internal/ui/views/launch/LaunchView incompatible with org/eclipse/debug/internal/ui/contexts/IDebugContextProvider
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.ClassCastException.<init>(ClassCastException.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.contexts.DebugWindowContextService.getActiveContext(DebugWindowContextService.java:175)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.contexts.DebugContextManager.getActiveContext(DebugContextManager.java:127)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.actions.AddMemoryRenderingActionDelegate.bindPart(AddMemoryRenderingActionDelegate.java:300)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.actions.AddMemoryRenderingActionDelegate.setActiveEditor(AddMemoryRenderingActionDelegate.java:238)

DebugWindowContextService#addProvider incorrectly stored the part in fProvidersByPartId.  It should have stored the provider passed in instead of the actual part since the list stores providers by part id.
Fixed in DebugWindowContextService to store provider properly.
